title: (x) Chase Bank logo - Zekton (customised) {Dav}
content:
anyone know this font? it’s similar to Welcome which i LOVE but it’s not for sale:  
 [http://www.whitestone.ac/clients/2006/typeface.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20100102095147/http:/www.whitestone.ac/clients/2006/typeface.htm "http://www.whitestone.ac/clients/2006/typeface.htm")

anyone know this font for chase bank or anything similar?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100102095147im_/http:/typophile.com/files/chase.gif)
author: efthomas

comments.content:
If its ’just’ the logo this could have been easily custom made, or customized  
_( An alternate may be ’ [Zekton](http://web.archive.org/web/20100102095147/http:/www.typodermic.com/fonts/16.html)’, a typeface that originally started out as a free font by Ray Larabie; [Just cut the angles of ’C’, ’S’ and ’E’, leave the ’H’ and ’connect’ the ’A’](http://web.archive.org/web/20100102095147/http:/image2.myfonts.com/textimage/c0/c003d5163e29f93e9ea25a57da55a1c2.png) )_

_( It may sound rude, But, That ’ [Welcome / 2006 FIFA World Cup Germany](http://web.archive.org/web/20100102095147/http:/www.whitestone.ac/clients/2006/typeface.htm)’ type has to be one of the ’oddest’, Ive seen in a while, Sorry, That just looks like one of those ’trendy’ free fonts )_

Dav
Chase used to use Eurostile as it’s logotype, and I think this is in some ways an update of that.

I just checked again, And, I think this actually IS _( based on )_ ’Zekton’ :)  
_( Look at the ’S’ and the ’E’ for example, they are slightly ’top heavy’, like ’Zekton’ )_

Dav
